prompt_to_run:
You will be given a task consisting of two parts:
1. A word-learning phase where you will be shown examples of a new word and give a similarity score of the word.
2. A similarity judgement phase where you will be asked to rate the similarity of pairs of objects for a total of 50 objects.


Mr. Frog speaks a different language, and you are helping him to pick out the object he wants. You'll be given a novel word and some examples of the word.

Here are three staws:
1. box truck
2. semi-trailer truck
3. garbage truck

Now pick out the other staws from the following list:
1. carrot
2. Dalmatian
3. seal
4. box truck
5. crane
6. eggplant
7. bear
8. yellow bell pepper
9. full-trailer truck
10. cat
11. loader
12. Labrador
13. bee
14. onion
15. red bell pepper
16. pumpkin
17. school bus
18. chiller truck
19. green bell pepper
20. basset hound
21. car


Next, for each pair of the objects below, rate the similarity of the two objects on a scale of 1 (not similar at all) to 9 (extremely similar). Try your best to base your ratings on the same aspects of the objects that were important to you in making your choices during the word-learning phase:

1. cat and full-trailer truck
2. box truck and carrot
3. school bus and pig
4. potato and bee
5. carrot and pig
6. crane and green bell pepper
7. toucan and eggplant
8. semi-trailer truck and tractor
9. box truck and loader
10. potato and carrot
11. pumpkin and garbage truck
12. carrot and tractor
13. potato and terrier
14. terrier and box truck
15. bear and Labrador
16. box truck and green bell pepper
17. onion and eggplant
18. tractor and pig
19. carrot and loader
20. carrot and green bell pepper
21. cat and Dalmatian
22. full-trailer truck and seal
23. box truck and pig
24. terrier and pumpkin
25. basset hound and tractor
26. full-trailer truck and onion
27. bear and seal
28. eggplant and Dalmatian
29. bear and red bell pepper
30. crane and Dalmatian
31. mutt and Labrador
32. car and seal
33. cat and carrot
34. motorcycle and school bus
35. potato and full-trailer truck
36. onion and tractor
37. crane and chiller truck
38. toucan and basset hound
39. yellow bell pepper and pumpkin
40. full-trailer truck and red bell pepper
41. full-trailer truck and pumpkin
42. semi-trailer truck and Labrador
43. box truck and garbage truck
44. yellow bell pepper and basset hound
45. mutt and onion
46. seal and bee
47. crane and garbage truck
48. semi-trailer truck and full-trailer truck
49. full-trailer truck and basset hound
50. car and Labrador


The output should be formatted as a JSON instance that conforms to the JSON schema below.

As an example, for the schema {"properties": {"foo": {"title": "Foo", "description": "a list of strings", "type": "array", "items": {"type": "string"}}}, "required": ["foo"]}
the object {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]} is a well-formatted instance of the schema. The object {"properties": {"foo": ["bar", "baz"]}} is not well-formatted.

Here is the output schema:
```
{"properties": {"objects_chosen": {"description": "objects that the word applied to", "items": {"type": "string"}, "title": "Objects Chosen", "type": "array"}, "choice_explanation": {"description": "explanation of objects chosen", "title": "Choice Explanation", "type": "string"}, "similarity_score": {"additionalProperties": {"type": "integer"}, "description": "similarity score for each pair of objects", "title": "Similarity Score", "type": "object"}}, "required": ["objects_chosen", "choice_explanation", "similarity_score"]}
```

Please be sure to give similarity scores to ALL 50 pairs of objects listed above.
